title: Baldur Installation
body:
Hi,

I would like to know if you had a solution regarding the following issue I've met during the installation step of the Baldur software : 

```
Compiling baldur v1.1.9 (/usr/bin/htslib-1.14/baldur)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> src/cli.rs:538:24
    |
538 |    let hts = Hts::open(input, "r")?;
    |                        ^^^^^ expected enum `Option`, found `&str`
    |
    = note:   expected enum `Option<_>`
            found reference `&str`
help: try wrapping the expression in `Some`
    |
538 |    let hts = Hts::open(Some(input), "r")?;
    |                        +++++     +

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `baldur` due to previous error
FATAL:   While performing build: while running engine: exit status 101
```

Have you already met this issue?

Best regards,
Boris

title: Get error when running " cargo build --release"
body:
hi heathsc,

title: Error:"  No contigs read in from reference file /mnt/d/DataNanoPore/reference/mtDNA_sequence.fasta
body:
hello, seems like something wrong, 
I've used the mtDNA_Sequence.fasta as a reference file, downloaded from NCBI. However I'm stuck there. What is wrong? 
 "  $baldur --rs-list $ref/bed_chr_MT.bed.gz -q10 -Q7 -M30 -T $ref/mtDNA_sequence.fasta -o $out/MT1_1 $sam/saMT1.sort.bam " (my code)

title: Large deletions issue

```
baldur -Q15 -T MT.fa barcode65.bam -o barcode65 -l debug
```

title: bam file problem
body:
The BAM file generated from whole genome alignment; it will freeze without any error message, as shown in the image below:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/605c400a-24f9-4222-b57c-5c3fdada4ba3)
